intro: Monttea chilensis var. taltalensis, commonly known as the Taltal monttea, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the coastal regions of northern Chile. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that store water, adapting to the arid and saline conditions of its habitat. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers during the cooler months, typically in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
